meetup-Big-Data-Cluj-Napoca-236137514.description:
Join us for an evening of exciting talks from Data Science Industry leaders and experts, followed by enough time for few beers, pizza and networking. We look forward to seeing you there! 

Register via Eventbrite!

https://youtu.be/qipAkjs6oVw

If you would like to get in touch with us for getting involved, please write us an email: [masked]. We hope to see you there for another night of great talks, few beers and some networking!
meetup-Big-Data-Cluj-Napoca-236137514.title: Big Data, Cluj

meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-234409.description:
1. Ovidiu Diaconescu, Charging Real $Money$ Every Month 

- How to be fully PCI DSS 3 compliant with Braintree Payments gateway. 

- Azure AspNetCore App that processes Credit Cards and Paypal 

- WebHooks for monthly validations.

2. Andrei Rinea, ASP.NET Core on OS X and Linux using an IDE

During this talk we will have a short introduction to developing and running ASP.NET Core on OS X and Linux using an IDE. ASP.NET Core not only runs on other OSs but productive development can now be achieved on these. Together with the participants we will walk through the main steps of creating and running a web application.
meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-234409.title: BrainTree Payments and ASP.NET Core on OS X and Linux using an IDE

meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235066.description:
1. Hosting Web Applications in the Azure App Service - deployment, scaling, monitoring, and more 

Prezentator: Julian Atanasoae, Azure App Service Support Engineer @ Microsoft

Descriere:

Build web apps that scale Code in your favorite language and IDE – .NET, NodeJS, PHP, Python, or Java – to build web apps and APIs faster than ever. Be more agile with continuous integration using Visual Studio Team Services or GitHub and with live-site debugging. Easily scale applications on-demand with high availability.

2. Audit/History in EF / Sql Server
Prezentator: Andrei Ignat, http://serviciipeweb.ro/iafblog/
Descriere:
Vom prezenta cum se poate obtine o tabela de istoric in SQL Server. Vom incepe cu ADO.NET, vom trece la EF, apoi trigger pe tabele si , in sfirsit, cele 2 solutii SQL Server: Change Data Capture si Temporal Tables
meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235066.title: Hosting Web App in the Azure App Service + Audit/History in EF / Sql Server

meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235100.description:
Prezentarea 1.SAP Hana Cloud Platform
Prezentator : Radu Simen,
Descriere:
i. Microservices with Java/Spring and Hana
ii. Front-end : Spring MVC si SAP UI5
iii. IaaS in HCP (VMs or Docker)

Prezentarea 2: Build an Intelligent Bot to Interact with your Users

Prezentator : Sorin Peste ,Microsoft, https://github.com/neaorin/BotFrameworkDemo


Bots are all the rage these days. But if you need one that's capable to understand your users' natural language, so it can figure out what they WANT and not just what they say, then you're going to need some pretty strong AI behind it. Come to this session to find out how you can use Microsoft Bot Framework together with Language Understanding Intelligent Service (luis.ai) to build an intelligent bot for Skype, Slack, Facebook, SMS and more.
meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235100.title: SAP Hana Cloud Platform & Build an Intelligent Bot to Interact with your Users

meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235101.description:
1. ASP.NET MVC 6
Prezentator: Andrei Ignat, http://msprogrammer.serviciipeweb.ro/
Descriere:
Ce a aparut nou in MVC Core ( MVC 6 ) si poate fi folosit in practica: tagHelpers, ViewComponents, altele. 

2.  Dockerizing an ASP.NET Core application and creating a CI/CD workflow with GitHub, Docker Hub, Docker Cloud and Microsoft Azure

Descriere:

In this session we will take a look at how to run ASP .NET Core apps inside Docker, then deploy it to a VM in Azure using Docker Cloud.
We will also see how to create a fully automated CI/CD flow using GitHub, Visual Studio Team Services and Docker Hub.


Prezentator: Radu Matei, https://radu-matei.github.io/blog/
meetup-Bucharest-A-D-C-E-S-Meetup-235101.title: ASP.NET MVC 6 What's new & Dockerizing an ASP.NET Core application

meetup-Bucharest-Startup-Founder-101-236.description:
This is a free, online event that you can participate in from your computer. To join and get the access link, you must register at https://app.webinarjam.net/register/24710/4737e454c4. If you can't make it, you can still register on that page to get the video recording after the event!   

----

Since 2009, the Founder Institute has helped launch over 600 female-led businesses across six continents, which have collectively raised over $65M in funding (http://fi.co/posts/28581). 

On this special, online "Female Founder Demo Day" event, five up-and-coming female-led startups from across the globe will present their businesses to top venture capital investors for feedback. 

Tune in to see presentations from the companies you will be reading about tomorrow! 

RESERVE A FREE SPOT [limited space]: https://app.webinarjam.net/register/24710/4737e454c4

If you are an investor and want to see presentations from top seed-stage technology companies from across the globe, then be sure to join. 

Or, if you are a startup looking to pitch investors and want to discover what startup investors look for in pitches, this online demo day is your opportunity to learn inside tips and tricks. 

Join us for this online and educational event!

--- 

This is a free, online event that you can participate in from your computer. To join and get the access link, you must register at https://app.webinarjam.net/register/24710/4737e454c4. If you can't make it, you can still register on that page to get the video recording after the event!
meetup-Bucharest-Startup-Founder-101-236.title: Female Founder Online Demo Day: Watch Presentations from Up-and-Coming Startups
meetup-Bucharest-Startup-Founder-101-236.venue: Online Webinar: On Your Computer, Bucharest

meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235954475.description:
Hi CluJSers, 

What a better way to end the year than in a cozy place, with really interesting topics to explore, good music, friends, and a lot of fun? 

Without further introductions, here's our speakers list:

Melania Moldovan
Melania is a software engineer for over 6 years. She promotes clean code principles regardless of the programming language, and her programming passion is JavaScript. She'll take you in a trip to your own childhood, and she'll share some ideas on how to love your toys

Update: Eliza Nitoi and Mihai Popa
Eliza and Mihai are two passionate young developers who had an idea and decided to do it, so they've build a web application, together with two more friends. They are going to talk about their idea, the technologies used, their struggles in order to get to the point they are now and how important feedback was for them.

Vlad Nicula
"I'm a JavaScript developer that likes to maintain an active and healthy lifestyle. This involves working out, dancing and healthy eating. I'll talk a bit about latin dances and how they are a great blend of physical activity and socialising. That's just what we need after a day of hard work."

On top of that, Alexandra Retegan will share some thoughts on how was 2016 for CluJSers, and what are our future plans.She's an enthusiastic human being, with a strong passion for organizing events, firmly believing in the power of the community. Using coffee as a creative fuel. She loves seeing herself and others grow so she invests much of her time in this direction. 

As always, we have a surprise guest. She'll bring that little extra to make this an amazing evening, and the only thing we can say now is it that she'll charm you with her talent!

With that in mind, we invite you to our last event this year. It's going to be good, it always is :)

Cheers!

PS. Don't forget to check our facebook group where a lot of interesting things happen.
meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235954475.title: Social Event #3 - Wrapping up an amazing year!
meetup-Cluj-Javascripters-235954475.venue: Bulgakov Soulfood & Café: Strada Inocențiu Micu Klein, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Cluj-Napoca-OpenStreetMap-Meetup-.description:
At our next meetup we will continue to improve navigation data in OpenStreetMap.  

As guests, we will have the members of the Map Analysts team from Telenav: they will review the key elements from the last meetup presentation and they will show us how to edit navigation attributes.

This meetup will be focused mostly on editing, so please bring your laptops and chargers.

If you want to read more about the subject, here you can find some useful resources.
meetup-Cluj-Napoca-OpenStreetMap-Meetup-.title: OSMTime – Improving navigation data in OpenStreetMap
meetup-Cluj-Napoca-OpenStreetMap-Meetup-.venue: skobbler/Telenav office: Cuza Voda, nr 1, Cluj-Napoca, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.description:
Programul intalnirii:
6:30-7:00 sosirea participantilor + pizza din partea Ullink
7:00 - 8:30 - Lőrinc Pap - Creating an effective persistent ArrayList alternative

Globally propagating mutations hinder us from being able to reason about an application with only minimal knowledge of its surroundings, from stepping back in a debugger and replaying the whole sequence of operations, from creating simple performance benchmarks or tests, without being concerned with the overall state of the application at all times.

Let’s see how we could design for correcting many of these issues, by creating a data structure that has the same (or better!) space/time complexities than Java’s beloved ArrayList does, and by providing a real-world example where it would shine with its simplicity.

We will explore some of the design compromises we took when creating Javaslang’s persistent Radix-Balanced Vector tree, and compare it to Scala and Clojure – feature and performance-wise.
meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.title: Creating an effective persistent ArrayList alternative
meetup-Cluj-fp-235901256.venue: Sediul Ullink: Str Victor Deleu nr 1, et 3 (intrarea dinspre Parcul Caragiale), cluj-napoca

meetup-Google-Developer-Group-Cluj-Napoc.description:
Google is promoting Firebase in December! A Codelab or a Hackathon will take place globally in every GDG chapter this December. We have swags prepared for everyone who attends and you will get the chance to enter the contest for wining a free ticket to Google I/O 2017!

We invite you to join us at a Firebase Codelab session to improve your knowledge and give you a better chance to win that ticket!

About the speaker:

Sebastian Presecan is co-founder and CTO @ PANGEA and works together with his team at international level projects. Sebi is one of the few developers that can easily talk about mobile, mobile cloud, IDEs, IoT and more. He coordinated developer teams, he developed architectures and complex solutions for which we consider it is an opportunity to meet him and challenge him to share his experience at the Christmas Firebase event.

Agenda:

18:30 - 19:00 reception

19:00 - 21:00 codelab

Target audience:

• students / developers (level: beginner and mid)


Requirements:

• minimal programming knowledge

• bring your laptop and install Git, Node.js (with npm) and an IDE/text editor (ex: WebStorm, Visual Studio Code, Sublime etc.)

• a Google account for creating the Firebase project
meetup-Google-Developer-Group-Cluj-Napoc.title: GDG - Firebase Christmas Lab
meetup-Google-Developer-Group-Cluj-Napoc.venue: HPE, The Office, 5th floor: Bulevardul 21 Decembrie 1989, Nr 77, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-IS-DevOps-Meetup-235774728.description:
2016 Recap part

Speaker: Irina Magdici (Odobescu)

Nearing the end of 2016, let's look back at this year and recap how DevOps domain evolved and what it brought new. 

Story Telling part

Speaker: everyone

Share frustrations, deep dark desires about what you want to change in your CI/CD pipeline at work and what happened in 2016 that was good for your devops soul.
meetup-IS-DevOps-Meetup-235774728.title: 2016 DevOps recap and Story Telling

meetup-MobOS-2017-235835213.description:
MobOS stands for Mobile Operating Systems and it represents the Community of Mobile Developers in Romania. Every year, we organize a conference to gather all mobile passionate, learn from international speaker and network with like minded peers.

We are now getting things ready for the 4th edition of the conference during 16-17 February 2017, in Cluj Napoca. This will mark the peak of the event, making it the Biggest Conference on Mobile Technologies in Romania.

Find out more details & register here: http://romobos.com/

And hope to see you soon at MobOS!
meetup-MobOS-2017-235835213.title: MobOS Conference 4th Edition
meetup-MobOS-2017-235835213.venue: Grand Hotel Napoca: str. Octavian Goga nr.1, 400698, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Mobile-Growth-Bucharest-235895338.description:
RSVP FOR THIS MEETUP HERE


We invite you to a new edition of Mobile Growth, with experts from the mobile gaming sector who are ready to share their experiences and strategies for growth, retention, and engagement. We'll kick off the evening with food and drinks, then hear from a few great minds in mobile about growth tactics and best practices they use to engage with users. Then we'll turn it over to you for a quick Q&A and round the evening out with time to socialize and talk about all the cool things you just learned.

The People 
</a><a href="https://ro.linkedin.com/in/radu-ziemba-086a1b90/en">Radu Ziemba, CEO, Kappsule Studios
Emilia Munteanu, Product Manager, Amber Studio
Andrei Bucur, Product Manager, Gameloft  


The Plan 
6.30pm - Check-in and onsite registration 
7.00pm - Welcome and introductions 
7.15 pm - Mobile Growth Panel
7.45pm - Q&A from Audience 
8.00pm - Social Hour

The Sponsors 
Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow your business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. Branch links drive app conversions, engagement, and retention on every marketing channel. Branch powers over 1.5 billion links a day for thousands of users across the world. Find out more about Branch and our Mobile Growth Community online.
meetup-Mobile-Growth-Bucharest-235895338.title: Mobile Growth Bucharest w/ Kappsule Studios, Amber Studio, & Gameloft
meetup-Mobile-Growth-Bucharest-235895338.venue: TechHub: Parter, Strada Nicolae Filipescu 39-41, Bucharest

meetup-Product-Camp-Bucharest-Meetup-235.description:
Hi Product Campers,

Our next meetup is about “Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

"What are the consequences of not having mentioned the unilateral termination of a service contract?

What options do you have if the client is not paying you?

What are the hidden risks to consider when the lease agreement on your office headquarters is close to expiration?

This workshop, built upon my years of experience in working with both young and experienced entrepreneurs, aims to provide insight into how even the simplest contractual clauses can hide unfortunate consequences that can lead anywhere from loss of profit to loss or reputation or even bankruptcy.

Understanding such issues can help you make an informed decision and mitigate risks or even avoid them altogether."

In the second part we have Open Space and we invite you to come up with your topic or question related to Product Development, Software Product Management, or anything related to our theme.

Agenda:

18:45 - 19:00 Welcome Product Campers

19:00 - 20:00 "Contractual Risks” by Lawyer Ioana Anda Bălașa

20:00 - 20:10 BREAK

20:10 - 21:15 Open Space

See you at Tech Hub Bucharest on Monday, 23rd January 2017!
meetup-Product-Camp-Bucharest-Meetup-235.title: Product Camp Bucharest #9 - "Contractual Risks in Early Stage Business"

meetup-StartupGrindClujNapoca-236134090.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Cluj Startups Christmas Charity Party (2016)

Startup people, UNITE!

Friday 16, all the startup communities from Cluj are attending the first Cluj Startups Christmas Charity! It's an event that has an amazing program prepared for you. Check it out!

1. Startup Grind fireside chat with an amazing founder (Details coming soon)

2. Immediately following the fireside chat, we will enjoy a premier in Cluj. The 20-minutes movie "The Spring" from charity: water. How charity: water came to be, and how one million people have become part of their story.

3. After this we invite you to enjoy the drinks, the finger food and the upbeat chillout music prepared by Dodo.

Why are we doing this? As we approach the holiday season, we wanted to take a step back and look at everything that’s happened over the last year and be grateful for every help we got and so, the time came to put our hands together to reach out and give a hand for those who are in a grater need then us, their need being more vital to their basic existence: Water.

Join us! It will be fun! :) 

Agenda

7:00 pm Startup Grind Fireside Chat

8:00 pm The 20-minutes movie "The Spring" from charity: water.

8:30 pm Fun Time :)

Hosted By Stefan Koritar, Cluj-Napoca Director

https://res.cloudinary.com/startup-grind/image/upload/c_fill,f_auto,g_center,h_700,q_auto:good,w_700/v1/softlayer0/80135C1/media/v1/AUTH_d0619b05-07fc-49f0-8249-da585ea45ce5/avatars/stefan_koritar.JPG

Transilvania Tech Valley startup man. Product Manager at Telenav. Stefan is also a startup ecosystem enthusiast and builder, sharing at stefankoritar.com.


Twitter: @skoritar Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Partner

Telenav's mission is to help reduce stress, improve productivity, and make life more fun for people on the go. Our personalized navigation services help people make smarter decisions about where to go, what to do, when to leave, and how to get there.

Our products are available in the U.S., Europe, Asia, and Latin America through wireless carriers, automobile manufacturers, advertisers and advertising agencies, and app developers. For more info please visit us at: www.telenav.com.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 200 cities and 85 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
meetup-StartupGrindClujNapoca-236134090.title: Cluj Startups Christmas Charity Party (2016)
meetup-StartupGrindClujNapoca-236134090.venue: Impact Hub: Str. Gării nr. 21, clădirea D, parter Liberty Technology Park, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.description:
Tabara de Testare se implica mai mult in domeniul automotive. Revenim cu detalii.

===========================================

Mai jos e lista cu propunerile pe urmatorul an:

- Training SQL - Nivel Mediu (recapitulare nivel Basic, la inceput)

- Time and Risk Management

- Comunicare - colegi, dev/tester

* Biblioteca cu informatii utile:

- certificari, carti, linkuri (recomandare: http://testhuddle.com/)

- Technical movie nights: Pluralsight, Coursera

- UFT (QTP), Selenium WebDriver, TFS, SoapUI (basic training)

* Co-interesare: traininguri, conferinte, certificari

- Prezentari si workshop-uri "Eu am mai facut si vreau sa ajut"

- Prezentation Skills (Moderator Surpriza)

- .Net, Java, Html, CSS, Notiuni de OOP, etc - Basic -> Intermediate

- Prezentari cu traineri certificati

- Add fun stuff

- Database performance testing

- implementarea unor design patterns in testarea automata (in afara de Page Objects)

- Cum tot mai multi lucreaza in Agile, poate ar fi interesanta prezentarea unui mediu de continuos integration (principii, cum se lucreaza cu el si ce se poate face) din perspectiva testarii. - Done - la editia aniversara de 3 ani.
meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.title: TM 53 TDT - Automotive
meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.venue: Autoliv: Openville, No.1 Aristide Demetriade Street, Timisoara

- Comunicare - colegi, dev/tester

* Biblioteca cu informatii utile:

- certificari, carti, linkuri (recomandare: http://testhuddle.com/)

- Technical movie nights: Pluralsight, Coursera

- UFT (QTP), Selenium WebDriver, TFS, SoapUI (basic training)

* Co-interesare: traininguri, conferinte, certificari

- Prezentari si workshop-uri "Eu am mai facut si vreau sa ajut"

- Prezentation Skills (Moderator Surpriza)

- .Net, Java, Html, CSS, Notiuni de OOP, etc - Basic -> Intermediate

- Prezentari cu traineri certificati

- Add fun stuff

- Database performance testing

- implementarea unor design patterns in testarea automata (in afara de Page Objects)

- Cum tot mai multi lucreaza in Agile, poate ar fi interesanta prezentarea unui mediu de continuos integration (principii, cum se lucreaza cu el si ce se poate face) din perspectiva testarii. - Done - la editia aniversara de 3 ani.

meetup-Tabara-de-Testare-Timisoara-mktmf.venue: ARIES-TM Asociatia Romana pentru Industria Electronica si Software - Filiala Timisoara: Str. Paris, nr. 2A, Timisoara, Timisoara

meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.description:
A Coding Dojo is a team practice format that accelerates knowledge transfer and sharing skills between team members. With an experienced facilitator, it is also a way of learning by applying various techniques.

Objectives

The following skills are typical candidates for improvement during a dojo:

• Refactoring
• Simple design
• Clean code
• Improving pair programming technique
• How to safely modify code you don't understand (usually legacy code)
• Learning a new programming language
• Unit testing
• Test driven development

In addition, coding dojo can be used by a team as a collective and structured way of solving difficult or risky problems related to production, like fixing a bug or redesigning parts of the application.

How it works?

The basic format of a coding dojo:

• All developers and the facilitator gather in a room.
• The facilitator introduces the purpose and the format of the coding dojo.
• One laptop with a functional development environment is connected to a projector.
• Two developers pair program on the laptop. The others are in the room, watching the code changes.
• Every 7 minutes, one developer leaves the laptop and the next one from the room takes his place.
• After a specified period of time (usually around two hours), the dojo ends with a retrospective.
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.organizer: The Bucharest Agile Software Meetup Group
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.title: Coding Dojo
meetup-The-Bucharest-Agile-Software-Meet.venue: Mozaic Works : Blv. Carol I, Nr. 26, Et.1, Sector 3, Bucharest

meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.description:
Timisoara Mobile Development Group and the local Google Developer Group together the Computers and Information Technology Department of Politehnica University and Intuitive Software are jointly inviting city's tech passionates to an event that will close the year in force!

We will focus on Firebase, the 15 tools kit supporting serverless architecture and significantly faster mobile (both iOS & Android) and web development.

We'll get the community together for a less practiced event format: two presentations will be followed by hands-on coding experience crafted by Googlers for developers. 

Alexandru Topirceanu and Claudiu Groza will present their experiences dealing with Firebase tools from teaching staff respectively app developer position. 

Their input will be followed by a 45-60 minutes codelab session, so all participants should make sure to bring their laptops!


Participants will receive swag offered by Google Firebase and will enter a (CEE regional) contest for winning a free ticket to Google I/O 2017! 

In order to organize for a small catering, we are charging a small participation fee, participants may pay from their card or PayPal account via Meetup.com. Upon requests via event comments we'll refund students that are stating they are not producing revenues as employees or freelancers.

If you will not be in Timisoara for that day, check on this map, maybe you can attend another Firebase event.

Looking forward to share the Christmas tech magic with you!

Radu Ticiu & Silviu Vert
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.title: TiMo & GDG Christmas Firebase Codelab
meetup-TiMoDev-235710973.venue: Timișoara Startup Hub: 10th, C. Brediceanu St., E Building, Timisoara, Timisoara

meetup-Timisoara-Java-User-Group-2359245.description:
Hello, everyone!


TM-JUG and our friends from Crossover invite you to a (slightly) informal TM-JUG meeting, where I will present an introduction to some of the most useful features from Java 8 (streams, functional programming and Optional objects), followed by a workshop on them.

You can also bring your legacy projects, so that we can 'Java 8 enhance' them; we'll lambda-ify the code, stream-ify the collections and Optional-ize the (potential) NPEs :)


The workshop will be held on the 15th of December, in the 'Atena' hall from Hotel Timisoara, starting from 18:30.


Prerequisites:

• laptop with JDK 8 pre-installed;

• IDE - IntelliJ IDEA, Ultimate edition (preferably); we'll discuss more about the 'whys' in the workshop.

Have a great week!
meetup-Timisoara-Java-User-Group-2359245.title: The 27th TM-JUG meeting - Java 8 intro and workshop

meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.description:
Agenda:

• Serverless computing - How to fire your Sysadmin and and run your code in a scalable and secure environment - Silviu Niculita (Head of Technology - Yonder)


The future of cloud is serverless computing. All of the major cloud providers are going all-in on this new “serverless" paradigm. Amazon Web Service’s Lambda, Google’s Cloud Functions, IBM’s OpenWhisk, and now Azure’s Functions. This session will cover the basic principles of implementing serverless architectures and zoom into Microsoft's offering in this space.

• CloudWars - Develop IaaS automation solutions for Amazon WebServices in CloudSlang - Alina Ciobanca (HPE) and Mihai Tusa (Betfair)

Use open source CloudSlang orchestration technology to create infrastructure provisioning workflows. Lessons learned from from using jClouds Google Java library vs classic API calls.
meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.title: IaaS - Infrastructure provisioning in the cloud
meetup-TransylvaniaCloud-235515094.venue: HPE The Office, 5th floor (C & D): Bulevardul 21 Decembrie 1989, Nr 77, Cluj-Napoca

meetup-angularjs-cluj-235644519.description:
At this meetup we invite everyone to come and share their experience in building a startup. 


We welcome all startup owners to come and present the idea behind their startup with a focus on the core technologies used in developing their system since we are at the Fullstack meetup. :)

The format is as always an open discussion where everyone can contribute and share their thoughts freely.

The current startups are:

• CleverWash


• Microhub


• Pașii Mei


• Littledata.io


• iBenefits.ro


• ComplyAdvantage


• CoinFlux.com


If you have a startup that you want to present just add a comment to this meetup and we will add it in the list.
meetup-angularjs-cluj-235644519.title: Building a startup

meetup-eat-pray-tech-236111694.description:
Gândul veșniciei poate fi suprimat!


Dacă cumva ți-ai pierdut drumul, nu-ți pierde și adresa!


Suntem înconjurați de tehnologie, ne hrănim cu ea și, în consecință, ne influențează modul în care gândim și trăim. 


La eat/pray/tech dorim să ne întâlnim și să ne împingem gândurile dincolo de limitările acesteia. Vrem să căutăm răspunsuri acolo unde 1+1 nu dă întotdeauna 2.

Ne frământăm cu întrebările importante și dificile ale vieții, îndreptându-ne ochii, inima și mintea spre Dumnezeu.

Nu în ultimul rând, ne întâlnim ca să ne cunoaștem mai bine, să luăm micul dejun împreună și, bineînțeles, și prima doză de cafeină a zilei.



Unde?

HUGO Restaurants, cladirea The Office, Bulevardul 21 Decembrie 1989 nr. 77.


Cost

Taxa este de 20 RON și se va achita la locație, numerar. Aceasta reprezintă contravaloarea unui bogat mic dejun, cu suc și cafea.

Social Media

O să comunicăm pe Facebook, Twitter si Instagram folosind #EatPrayTech.
meetup-eat-pray-tech-236111694.title: eat/pray/tech #7

meetup-lean-startup-bucharest-235963618.description:
Salut!

In primul rand, doresc sa adresez o urare speciala pentru aceasta zi de 1 decembrie :

Sunt increzator ca lucrurile se vor imbunatati prin creare pe viitor de solutii pertinente si relevante pentru societatea in care traim - ideea pe care o putem realiza doar impreuna cu alte persoane manate de aceleasi nazuinte.

Si dincolo de o limba de lemn formala, ne-am gandit sa organizam o petrecere de Craciun, asemanatoare cu cea de anul trecut ca format - stim ca aceea a avut un impact puternic pentru participanti si am zis sa mai incercam inca o data. :)

Atunci am avut parte de o atmosfera prietenoasa, muzica de calitate si mancare gustoasa (3 bucatari) si de multa interactiune, atat "structurata" (startup-talks), cat si "libera".

O sa imprumutam anumite elemente din intalnirea precedenta, insa evident ca va fi un _alt_ experiment.


Va asteptam cu interes. :) 

https://pixel.watch/mtaw

Mentionez ca exista costuri de organizare la care sunteti rugati sa contribuiti aici:

Contributie: 50 RON

- Platibila online:

PayPal / card bancar prin PayPal

- Transfer bancar : 

SC BRUNOMAG CONSULTING SRL 

IBAN: RO11BTRLRONCRT[masked]
meetup-lean-startup-bucharest-235963618.title: X-mas Sunday Party 2016
meetup-lean-startup-bucharest-235963618.venue: Promocrat.ro: Mihai Eminescu 142, Et.1, Ap.1, Bucharest

meetup-papers-we-love-bucharest-23611531.description:
Papers We Love Bucharest is happy to announce the meetup #12 in which we'll present and discuss the original papers of Principal Component Analysis (PCA) as we call it today in machine learning, a very beautiful and useful algorithm! It is a nice opportunity to review together its mathematical background from both modern and historical perspective and see some code demos!

Principal Component Analysis - the original papers

Original Paper:

K. Pearson, "On lines and planes of closest fit to systems of points in space", Philosophical Magazine, Vol. 2, No. 6. (1901), pp. [masked]

As usual, we'll not limit the presentation to the original papers.

Speaker:

Adrian Florea is a machine learning enthusiast, currently taking a sabbatical year to prepare a change in his career towards machine learning and data science. He has 24 years of professional software experience, 7 of which having worked abroad, in Milan, Italy. He is co-founder of the Italian Solution Architects User Group and a Microsoft Community Influencer (2008).

Looking forward to seeing you all.
meetup-papers-we-love-bucharest-23611531.title: Papers We Love December Meetup #12

meetup-todaysoftmag-236067850.description:
18:00 Networking și răsfoirea revistei
18:15 Deschiderea evenimentului 
18:20 Prezentări articole

- Bluetooth Beacon Tracking – It Works Both Ways - Cătălin Huzum (Accenture)

- Behavior Driven Development - Alexandru Vlăduț (msg systems)

- Domain Driven Design: soluția esențială pentru produse stabile pe termen lung - Ciprian Stupinean (Ve Interactive)

- Tracking Quality: monitorizarea calității produselor cu ajutorul senzorilor - Ioana Lazarescu (Bosch)

- IoT wisdom - Andrei Crăciun (Avelon Cetex AG)

19:20 Pauză & networking

19:50 Expert talks panel - Panel: Tendințe și realizări IoT 

Invitați: 

- Radu Vunvulea (iQuest)

- Zsolt Kovács si Tófalvi Lázsló (Accenture)

- Andrei Crăciun (Avelon Cetex AG)


20:50 Walkthrough in the Accenture IoT lab


Acces eveniment: Sigma Center, etaj 6, intrarea de lângă Lidl, Cluj-Napoca
* Participarea este gratuită
** Evenimentul este găzduit de Accenture
*** Participanții vor primi ultimul număr al Today Software Magazine
**** Evenimentul este publicat și pe Facebook.com
meetup-todaysoftmag-236067850.title: Lansarea TSM decembrie & Panel: Tendințe și realizări IoT
